Oriol Junqueras, "harto" de la "inmadurez" de Pedro Sánchez
"Con este PSOE no tenemos nada que hablar" afirma el líder de ERC, que llama a derrotar a los socialistas en las urnasSubraya que "la cárcel no soluciona nada" y avisa de que "el camino hacia la independencia está en un punto de no retorno"
06 Nov 2019, 08:09 by Agencias
El líder de ERC, Oriol Junqueras, ha cargado con dureza contra Pedro Sánchez. En una entrevista en SER Catalunya, Junqueras afirma estar "harto" de "las amenazas y de la inmadurez" del presidente del Gobierno en funciones y candidato del PSOE. Así, le ha acusado de amenazar con el 155, de atacar a la escuela y los medios públicos catalanes y de negar la democracia al querer prohibir referéndums que se consideren ilegales: Con este PSOE, ha dicho, "no solo no tenemos nada que hablar, sino que nos tendrá delante".
"Tenemos que derrotarlo en las urnas, --ha subrayado Junqueras-- porque es la única forma que entienda que a Catalunya se la debe escuchar y se la tiene que respetar". "Estamos más que hartos de sus amenazas y de su inmadurez política", ha insistido.
El exvicepresidente del Govern ha acusado a "los poderes del Estado" de "poner en marcha una campaña para intentar dividir a los independentistas" y para vincular el independentismo con la violencia.
Apuesta por la vía pacífica
Sobre los actos de violencia en las calles tras conocerse la sentencia del 'procés', el líder de ERC afirma que no le gustan, pero ha matizado que le disgustan más "los excesos policiales que todo el mundo ha podido ver en las imágenes". "No me gusta que se queme un contenedor, pero mucho menos que se golpee en la cabeza con una porra", indica Junqueras, antes de añadir que entiende la frustración de muchos jóvenes "porque el nivel de injusticia y de brutalidad es muy grande y creen que no avanzamos".
Ahora bien, puntualiza, "creo que la vía ganadora es la pacífica y masiva" y advierte de que "desde siempre el Estado ha querido vincular al movimiento independentista con la violencia, este es su plan, porque en este terreno gana siempre". "No caigamos en sus trampas", alerta Junqueras, porque "el movimiento (independentista) es netamente pacífico y democrático, y esta es la vía para desmontar este estado represivo y autoritario".
"La cárcel no soluciona nada"
En relación con la sentencia, Junqueras indica que "optar por la vía de la represión le puede servir al Estado en un periodo corto, pero no podrá ganarnos con el Código Penal, ya que encarcelar a demócratas por poner las urnas no soluciona nada, más bien lo contrario, hace que la gente decida que no quiere seguir viviendo en un Estado como este".
El presidente de ERC dice estar convencido de que "el camino hacia la independencia ya ha entrado en un punto de no retorno, creo que es irreversible", y recalca que "es evidente que el mes de octubre del 2017 no acabó nada y ahora que ha salido la sentencia tampoco" puesto que "con represión no pueden parar este movimiento". 
"Error estratégico" de JxCat
También se ha referido a las discrepancias entre ERC y JxCat. Concretamente, al ser preguntado por las críticas de JxCat a Esquerra, Junqueras ha calificado de "error estratégico" basar una campaña electoral en atacar constantemente a otros partidos independentistas.
Preguntado sobre una posible convocatoria de elecciones en Catalunya tras las generales, Junqueras ha respondido: "Parece evidente que no podemos tardar mucho en volvernos a contar, pero a la vez también creo que ahora no es el momento", aunque ha añadido que a su partido no le dan miedo las urnas.

Oriol Junqueras, "fed up" with the "immaturity" of Pedro Sánchez
"With this PSOE we have nothing to talk about," says the leader of ERC, who calls to defeat the Socialists at the polls. He emphasizes that "the prison does not solve anything" and warns that "the road to independence is at a point of no return"
06 Nov 2019, 08:09 by Agencies
The leader of ERC, Oriol Junqueras, has charged hard against Pedro Sánchez. In an interview at SER Catalunya, Junqueras claims to be "fed up" with "the threats and immaturity" of the president of the acting Government and candidate of the PSOE. Thus, he has accused him of threatening 155, attacking the Catalan school and public media and denying democracy by wanting to ban referendums that are considered illegal: With this PSOE, he said, "we don't just have nothing to talk about , but it will have us ahead. "
"We have to defeat him at the polls, - Junqueras has stressed - because it is the only way he understands that Catalonia must be heard and must be respected." "We are more than fed up with his threats and his political immaturity," he insisted.
The former vice president of the Government has accused "the powers of the State" to "launch a campaign to try to divide the independence" and to link the independence movement with violence.
Bet on the peaceful way
On the acts of violence in the streets after knowing the sentence of the 'procés', the leader of ERC affirms that he does not like them, but he has clarified that he dislikes more "the police excesses that everyone has been able to see in the images". "I do not like to burn a container, but much less hit it on the head with a club," Junqueras says, before adding that he understands the frustration of many young people "because the level of injustice and brutality is very large and they think we don't move forward. "
Now, he points out, "I think the winning route is the peaceful and massive one" and warns that "the State has always wanted to link the independence movement with violence, this is its plan, because in this field it always wins." "Let's not fall into their traps," Junqueras warns, because "the (independence) movement is clearly peaceful and democratic, and this is the way to dismantle this repressive and authoritarian state."
"The jail does not solve anything"
In relation to the sentence, Junqueras indicates that "opting for repression can serve the State in a short period of time, but it cannot win us with the Criminal Code, since imprisoning Democrats for putting the ballot boxes solves nothing, more quite the opposite, it makes people decide that they don't want to continue living in a state like this. "
The president of ERC says he is convinced that "the road to independence has already entered a point of no return, I think it is irreversible," and stresses that "it is clear that the month of October 2017 finished nothing and now that the sentence has not come out either "since" with repression they cannot stop this movement ".
"Strategic Error" by JxCat
He has also referred to the discrepancies between ERC and JxCat. Specifically, when asked about JxCat's criticisms of Esquerra, Junqueras has called "strategic error" to base an electoral campaign on constantly attacking other independence parties.
Asked about a possible call for elections in Catalonia after the generals, Junqueras has replied: "It seems clear that we can not take long to retell, but at the same time I also think that now is not the time," although he added that his Party is not afraid of the polls.
